meanings.definition: A person who lapses into previous bad habits or sinful behavior.
meanings.sent1: Some backsliders struggle to break free from their old ways.
meanings.sent2: The church community reached out to help the backsliders find their path again.
meanings.sent3: The backsliders at the support group shared stories of their journey to redemption.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the protagonist faces a group of backsliders who tempt him with his past.
meanings.sent5: The image of the backsliders falling back into darkness haunted his dreams.

meanings.definition: Those who regress in their beliefs or principles.
meanings.sent1: The backsliders in the debate seemed unsure of their stance.
meanings.sent2: The political leader warned against becoming backsliders in their commitment to progress.
meanings.sent3: The backsliders in the group chat kept changing their opinions every minute.
meanings.sent4: She saw her friends as backsliders, losing sight of their original goals.
meanings.sent5: The backsliders in the story symbolized the dangers of losing faith in oneself.
